alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 7:34PM CDT until May 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GREENWOOD COUNTY... At 734 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Fall River, or 12 miles southeast of Eureka, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Severy, Fall River, Climax, Fall River Lake and Fall River State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
